trans-unit.source: Adding Mobile Services by using Connected Services in Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Adding Mobile Services by using Connected Services in Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services by using the Visual Studio Add Connected Services dialog box
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services by using the Visual Studio Add Connected Services dialog box

trans-unit.source: Adding Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services
trans-unit.target: Adding Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services

trans-unit.source: With Visual Studio 2015, you can connect to Azure Mobile Services using the **Add Connected Service** dialog.
trans-unit.target: With Visual Studio 2015, you can connect to Azure Mobile Services using the **Add Connected Service** dialog.

trans-unit.source: You can connect from any C# client app, any JavaScript app, or cross-platform Cordova app.
trans-unit.target: You can connect from any C# client app, any JavaScript app, or cross-platform Cordova app.

trans-unit.source: Once you connect, you can create and access data, create custom APIs and scheduled jobs, or add support for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Once you connect, you can create and access data, create custom APIs and scheduled jobs, or add support for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The connected services operation adds all appropriate references and connection code.
trans-unit.target: The connected services operation adds all appropriate references and connection code.

trans-unit.source: You can also take advantage of built-in support for authentication with a variety of popular identity schemes, such as Azure AD, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft Accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can also take advantage of built-in support for authentication with a variety of popular identity schemes, such as Azure AD, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft Accounts.

trans-unit.source: Supported Project Types
trans-unit.target: Supported Project Types

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In Visual Studio 2015, adding Azure Mobile Services to a Windows Universal (Windows 10) projects by using the Add Connected Services dialog is not supported.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In Visual Studio 2015, adding Azure Mobile Services to a Windows Universal (Windows 10) projects by using the Add Connected Services dialog is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You can add Azure Mobile Services by installing the appropriate packages using the NuGet Package Manager for your project.
trans-unit.target: You can add Azure Mobile Services by installing the appropriate packages using the NuGet Package Manager for your project.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Connected Services dialog to connect to Azure Mobile Services in the following project types.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Connected Services dialog to connect to Azure Mobile Services in the following project types.

trans-unit.source: .NET Windows 8.1 Store, Phone, and Universal App projects
trans-unit.target: .NET Windows 8.1 Store, Phone, and Universal App projects

trans-unit.source: JavaScript Windows 8.1 Store, Phone, and Universal App projects
trans-unit.target: JavaScript Windows 8.1 Store, Phone, and Universal App projects

trans-unit.source: Projects created using Visual Studio Tools for Apache Cordova
trans-unit.target: Projects created using Visual Studio Tools for Apache Cordova

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure Mobile Services using the Add Connected Services dialog
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure Mobile Services using the Add Connected Services dialog

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure account, you can sign up for a [free trial](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=518146).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure account, you can sign up for a [free trial](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=518146).

trans-unit.source: Open the **Add Connected Services** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Add Connected Services** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: For .NET apps, open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the **References** node in Solution Explorer, and then choose **Add Connected Service**
trans-unit.target: For .NET apps, open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the **References** node in Solution Explorer, and then choose **Add Connected Service**

trans-unit.source: For Apache Cordova app projects, open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the project node in Solution Explorer, and then choose **Add Connected Service**.
trans-unit.target: For Apache Cordova app projects, open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the project node in Solution Explorer, and then choose **Add Connected Service**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Connected Service** dialog box, choose **Azure Mobile Services**, and then choose the **Configure** button.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Connected Service** dialog box, choose **Azure Mobile Services**, and then choose the **Configure** button.

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted to log into Azure if you haven't already done so.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted to log into Azure if you haven't already done so.

trans-unit.source: Adding an Azure Mobile Service
trans-unit.target: Adding an Azure Mobile Service

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Mobile Services** dialog box, choose an existing mobile service if you have one.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Mobile Services** dialog box, choose an existing mobile service if you have one.

trans-unit.source: If you need to create a new Azure mobile service, follow the procedure below to do so.
trans-unit.target: If you need to create a new Azure mobile service, follow the procedure below to do so.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, skip to the next step.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, skip to the next step.

trans-unit.source: To create a new mobile service account:
trans-unit.target: To create a new mobile service account:

trans-unit.source: choose the **Create Service **link at the bottom of the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: choose the **Create Service **link at the bottom of the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Add new mobile connected service
trans-unit.target: Add new mobile connected service

trans-unit.source: Review the getting started page that appears and find out how your project was modified.
trans-unit.target: Review the getting started page that appears and find out how your project was modified.

trans-unit.source: A Getting Started page appears in your browser whenever you add a connected service.
trans-unit.target: A Getting Started page appears in your browser whenever you add a connected service.

trans-unit.source: You can review the suggested next steps and code examples, or switch to the What Happened page to see what references were added to your project, and how your code and configuration files were modified.
trans-unit.target: You can review the suggested next steps and code examples, or switch to the What Happened page to see what references were added to your project, and how your code and configuration files were modified.

trans-unit.source: Using the code samples as a guide, start writing code to access your mobile service!
trans-unit.target: Using the code samples as a guide, start writing code to access your mobile service!

trans-unit.source: How your project is modified
trans-unit.target: How your project is modified

trans-unit.source: How Visual Studio modifies your project depends on the project type.
trans-unit.target: How Visual Studio modifies your project depends on the project type.

trans-unit.source: For C# client apps, see [What happend – C# projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513119).
trans-unit.target: For C# client apps, see [What happend – C# projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513119).

trans-unit.source: For JavaScript client apps, see [What happened – JavaScript projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513120).
trans-unit.target: For JavaScript client apps, see [What happened – JavaScript projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513120).

trans-unit.source: For Cordova apps, see [What happend – Cordova projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513116).
trans-unit.target: For Cordova apps, see [What happend – Cordova projects](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=513116).
